title: November 18
description:
The big news this week is that Felix has started reading! In the last year he's done a little reading with Ariel, the educational therapist, but hasn't really done it out of that setting. This week he's started picking up little books at home and reading them, slowly and laboriously, to Dean, Lucie and Milo. It takes him a lot of effort but he's choosing to do it, and he's very, very proud of himself.

When we read, we're seeing him pay more attention to the text. For example, Lucie was reading some numbers in a book and Felix asked, 'Where are they? I don't see them." They were written out, rather than numerals. He never used to ask that sort of question. Yay!

Video of Felix reading full sentences to Dean for the very first time:

children.title: Felix
children.description: Felix is in a really good space.  He's well-liked at school, has a ton of deep interests, gets along fantastically with his little brother, and is making huge progress at some things that we thought would be hard for him, like speaking French and learning to read.

children.title: Felix's Bike
children.description: Every morning on our bike ride to school we get passed by our EB buddies Nico, Frederic and Benjamin. They've been commenting that Felix needs a bigger bike.  Finally this weekend they passed down to us Nico's old bike. It's got a hand brake and everything! Felix is doing great on it.

children.title: Milo's Bike
children.description: We lowered the seat on Felix's old bike, slapped the training wheels back on, and let Milo take it for a spin.

children.title: Milo's Bike 2
children.description: Milo is a natural. He can already smoothly maneuver, go fast, and brake so hard he slides the tire. We're betting the training wheels will be off before his 4th birthday.

children.title: Dean's Bike
children.description: Dean got a new bike too. It's a KTM SuperDuke and it has chiseled good looks. Dean's old motorcycle had chronic electric problems that wore our patience thin.

children.title: Brunch 1
children.description:
Benjamin is firmly Felix's best friend at school. He and his family came over for Sunday brunch. We also invited Connor, another school friend, and his parents.

Connor's dad Patrick worked with Dean at Hotwired, 12 years ago, way back before any of us could possibly imagine that someday we'd all be attending PTA meetings.

children.title: Brunch 2
children.description: We've turned a page on playdates. Milo always wants to hang out with Felix and his friends but Felix used to plead with Lucie to keep him away.  No more! Milo has been accepted in the inner circle.

children.title: Brunch 3
children.description: <u>Clockwise, from front</u>: Benjamin, Lauren (Benjamin's little sister), Connor, Milo, Felix.

children.title: Ben's Book
children.description:
Benjamin is an amazing child. He is fascinated with maps and can already read and write well.

We were absolutely dumbstruck when he wrote a book for Felix. It has the complete and accurate driving directions from our house (he knows our address by heart) to his grandmother's in Oregon. From his head, no map or anything! Apparently he and Felix have plans to go and dig up a treasure in her yard.

children.title: Felix's Book
children.description: Felix and Lucie wrote a book for Benjamin in return.  It was full of puzzles, mazes and connect-the-dots.

children.title: Computer 1
children.description: The kids like a computer game called Reader Rabbit.  Felix typically operates the mouse and Milo watches his every move, transfixed.

children.title: Computer 2
children.description: Milo occasionally tries the mouse but it's still a bit frustrating.

children.title: First Tooth
children.description: Felix lost his first baby tooth! It came off at school. His teacher carefully put it in a envelope so he wouldn't lose it.

children.title: First Tooth 2
children.description:
As he tucked his tooth under his pillow, Felix had his hopes up. "Maybe I'll get a shiny silver dollar. That's what Benjamin got when his tooth fell out".

What he found in the morning was four quarters. Apparently his tooth tooth fairy doesn't plan in advance.

Fairy-wise, he's on a strict Don't Ask Don't Tell policy. He talked about what he hoped to get, but didn't even once mention the tooth fairy. It's the same with Santa Claus: he was full of questions at age 3 but by age 4 he was studiously mum.

children.title: French Book
children.description: Ecole Bilingue has a well-stocked library. Lucie is very happy to be able to borrow quality French children books.

children.title: First Book
children.description: Fantabulous! Felix proudly reads a book to Milo. It's a very simple book. It goes something like this: <cite>"Sam sat on Cat. Cat is sad. Ok, cat."</cite> Still, it's a huge first for Felix.  We're proud of him!

children.title: Web
children.description: Tragically, Felix was eaten by the giant spider.  He will be missed.
